entry.title: Red Wine Tea - Tin Can
entry.summary:
Vendor: Golden Tips Tea (India)
Type: Black Tea
Price: 6.91

Blending the natural essence of red wine with premium black tea, Red Wine Tea offers a distinctive and refined taste experience. Fruity and floral notes intertwine with earthy undertones, while hibiscus petals contribute a smooth, rounded flavor profile.

Versatile and aromatic, this tea can be enjoyed hot or cold - making it a sophisticated choice for elegant gatherings or a moment of indulgence.

entry.title: Pure Chamomile Herbal Infusion Tea- Tin Can
entry.summary:
Vendor: Golden Tips Tea (India)
Type: Herbal Tea
Price: 5.96

Chamomile is a herb that people have used for centuries. It is noted for its naturally calming energy and its ability to relax both body and mind. It is known to be a beverage which helps calm an upset stomach or assists in stress-busting and inducing sleep. The fruit-like flavour, similar to apple, makes the drink a delicacy. Can also be had with a dash of honey.

entry.title: Saffron Cardamom Exotic Chai India's Authentic Spiced Tea - Tin Can (Free Exotic Darjeeling Tea 35g)
entry.summary:
Vendor: Golden Tips Teas India
Type: Chai Teas
Price: 39.99

Health Benefits
  • Prevent Cold and Nasal Congestion.
  • Antioxidant-rich helps prevent cell damage.
  • Boost Energy and Immunity.
How to prepare a perfect cup:
  • Mix one portion of milk & two portions of water & set to boil.
  • When on boil add one teaspoon of Masala Chai and boil for another minute.
  • Add sugar as per taste & strain into a cup.
  • Best consumed with milk.

entry.title: White Exotica Tea - Tin Can
entry.summary:
Vendor: Golden Tips Teas India
Type: White Tea
Price: 11.10

An exotic White Tea from Darjeeling with each leaf picked tenderly and selectively just before sunrise. The fairly long, light & fluffy leaves of this tea type are an absolute visual delight. Cultivated in the picturesque slopes of the Himalayas at altitudes upto 2000 meters, this rare tea type has excellent health benefits and a very high amount of anti-oxidants, vitamins and minerals.

Learn more about white teas

entry.title: Peach Flavoured Black Tea - Tin can
entry.summary:
Vendor: Golden Tips Tea Co. (P) Ltd.
Type: Black Tea
Price: 9.75

A refreshing blend of fine black tea from Assam combined with natural extracts of peach. The tea is characteristic of a delightful aroma, dark Colour in the cup and fruity flavor of ripe peaches.

entry.title: Chocolate Flavoured Black Tea - Tin Can
entry.summary:
Vendor: Golden Tips Tea Co. (P) Ltd.
Type: Black Tea
Price: 9.75

A refreshing blend of high grow full leaf black tea combined with natural extracts of Chocolate. This bright Colouring tea makes for a robust and flavoury cup.
Brewing Notes:
Put 2 grams of Chocolate Black Tea Leaves in a cup. Pour 200ml of freshly boiled water over the leaves. Steep for 3-5 Minutes. Add sugar or honey as sweetener. Ice cubes may be added to chill. Best served without or with very little milk.

Price: 11.44

This tenderly plucked and carefully manufactured tea comes from the sole Temi Tea estate in the north-eastern state of Sikkim in India. The tea is an international favourite & is characteristic of a bright Colour in the cup with a unique and typical flavour

entry.title: Darjeeling Tea - Tin Can
entry.summary:
Vendor: Golden Tips Teas India
Type: Black Tea
Price: 11.55

A Premium high-grown from the most popular tea-growing region in the world, at the foothills of the Eastern Himalayas. This full leaf tea is known for its Nice Aroma, Strong Taste, and highly oxidized tea.
No Flavour and No Preservatives used in Tea processing, 100% real Darjeeling Leaf Tea with Nice Taste and High Antioxidants.
PACKAGING AND FRESHNESS:
Tea is Packed in a good quality sealed poly packed to save the aroma of tea and after that, it is packed in a good quality stainless steel Tin Can.
HOW TO BREW:
Heat your water to a boil and pour in a cup and add one tablespoon of Darjeeling leaves per 200 ml of water. Steep for 3 to 5 minutes depending on your taste, and try this tea without milk.
SUGGESTED READINGS:
All About Darjeeling Teas Discover Yourself with Darjeeling Tea Why Darjeeling Tea is the Champagne of Teas Health Benefits of Darjeeling Tea How to Make the Perfect Cup fo Darjeeling Tea Best Darjeeling Teas with Milk

entry.title: Earl Grey Tea - Tin Can
entry.summary:
Vendor: Golden Tips Teas India
Type: Black Tea
Price: 9.95

Select full leaf Tea, skilfully blended with the oil of
Bergamot with a fragrant, refreshing flavour. Earl Grey was popularised by the
British, hence the faint English undertone associated with it. If there was to be a ‘most
fashionable Tea award’ - it would arguably go to Earl Grey Tea with its immense popularity
among the creme-de-la-creme.

entry.title: Masala Chai India's Authentic Spiced Tea - Tin Can
entry.summary:
Vendor: Golden Tips Teas India
Type: Chai Teas
Price: 15.99

An age-old classic, Masala Chai, literally meaning “Spiced Tea” is one of the most popular tea blends in the world, originating from India. This unique & ancient preparation contains a strong flavoury black tea blended with a variety of aromatic spices.
The tea is characteristic of a rich & spicy aroma, a strong and perfectly balanced flavor with dark Colour in the cup.
The tea is characteristic of a rich & spicy aroma, a strong and perfectly balanced flavor with dark Colour in the cup.
Ingredients: 
Black Tea, Green Cardamom, Dry Ginger, Black Pepper, Long Pepper, Cloves, Bay Leaves, Cinnamon
Health Benefits
  • Prevent Cold and Nasal Congestion.
  • Antioxidant-rich helps prevent cell damage.
  • Boost Energy and Immunity.
How to prepare a perfect cup:
  • Mix one portion of milk & two portions of water & set to boil.
  • When on boil add one teaspoon of Masala Chai and boil for another minute.
  • Add sugar as per taste & strain into a cup.
  • Best consumed with milk.

entry.title: English Breakfast Tea - Tin Can
entry.summary:
Vendor: Golden Tips Teas India
Type: Black Tea
Price: 6.51

Initially known as Breakfast Tea, English breakfast is the most popular tea blend in the world. Popularized by the Queen Victoria of England, this robust tea is traditionally associated & paired with a hearty English breakfast. Our signature breakfast tea blend contains some of the finest tea leaves from Assam.
